intro: Wageneria deflexa, commonly known as the bent-leaved ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its unique, fleshy, and somewhat succulent leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale green or yellowish in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers a warm, sunny environment. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a houseplant.
